Now it came to pass on a certain day, that he went into a ship with his disciples: and he said unto them, Let us go over unto the other side of the lake. And they launched forth.
Now when Jesus saw great multitudes about him, he gave commandment to depart unto the other side.
And straightway Jesus constrained his disciples to get into a ship, and to go before him unto the other side, while he sent the multitudes away.

verses.text: And when they had sent away the multitude, they took him even as he was in the ship. And there were also with him other little ships.

similars.text: And they that were sent went their way, and found even as he had said unto them.

And great multitudes were gathered together unto him, so that he went into a ship, and sat; and the whole multitude stood on the shore.

And he sent away the multitude, and took ship, and came into the coasts of Magdala.
And the other disciples came in a little ship; (for they were not far from land, but as it were two hundred cubits,) dragging the net with fishes.

verses.text: And there arose a great storm of wind, and the waves beat into the ship, so that it was now full.

similars.text: But the Lord sent out a great wind into the sea, and there was a mighty tempest in the sea, so that the ship was like to be broken.
And the sea arose by reason of a great wind that blew.

But the ship was now in the midst of the sea, tossed with waves: for the wind was contrary.
And, behold, there arose a great tempest in the sea, insomuch that the ship was covered with the waves: but he was asleep.
And when they were come into the ship, the wind ceased.
And the sea arose by reason of a great wind that blew.

verses.text: And he was in the hinder part of the ship, asleep on a pillow: and they awake him, and say unto him, Master, carest thou not that we perish?

similars.text: So the shipmaster came to him, and said unto him, What meanest thou, O sleeper? arise, call upon thy God, if so be that God will think upon us, that we perish not.
And, behold, there arose a great tempest in the sea, insomuch that the ship was covered with the waves: but he was asleep.

verses.text: And he arose, and rebuked the wind, and said unto the sea, Peace, be still. And the wind ceased, and there was a great calm.

similars.text: And he saith unto them, Why are ye fearful, O ye of little faith? Then he arose, and rebuked the winds and the sea; and there was a great calm.

verses.text: And he said unto them, Why are ye so fearful? how is it that ye have no faith?

similars.text: And he saith unto them, Why are ye fearful, O ye of little faith? Then he arose, and rebuked the winds and the sea; and there was a great calm.
And he said unto them, Where is your faith? And they being afraid wondered, saying one to another, What manner of man is this! for he commandeth even the winds and water, and they obey him.
Then were the men exceedingly afraid, and said unto him, Why hast thou done this? For the men knew that he fled from the presence of the Lord, because he had told them.
And he said unto them, How is it that ye do not understand?
And he said unto them, How is it that ye do not understand?
And he said unto them, Why are ye troubled? and why do thoughts arise in your hearts?
Which when Jesus perceived, he said unto them, O ye of little faith, why reason ye among yourselves, because ye have brought no bread?
